text:
Celebs use a united voice to help at the disaster relief concert.

Jennifer Lopez, Marc Anthony and a Host of Stars Stand in Solidarity With Puerto Rico at the Somos Live!

By Jasmine Washington



From hurricanes to forest fires and earthquakes, natural disasters have been wreaking havoc throughout the US. Celebrities have taken on the call to raise awareness and donations in support of those impacted by the devastation.

Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony hosted the star studded One Voice: Somos Live disaster relief concert in honor of their beloved Puerto Rico. Demi Lovato, DJ Khaled, Ricky Martin, Gwen Stefani, Alex Rodriguez, Mary J. Blige and Jamie Foxx were among the celebs who hit the stage to raise funds for those affected by Hurricane Maria in PR.

Lopez, who has donated $1 million to hurricane relief efforts, took to the stage stressing the importance of coming together in the face of adversity. She also took a not so subtle dig at Donald Trump’s recent visit to Puerto Rico. “There are some messes you can’t clean up with paper towels,” taunting the fact that Trump tossed rolls of paper towels at hurricane survivors.

One of the most recent updates from the relief benefit revealed that there had been over $20 million donated.

Kim Kardashian West, Ellen DeGeneres and Selena Gomez also took part in the fundraising efforts on behalf of the American Red Cross, Reach Out Worldwide, United Way, United for Puerto Rico and other charities.

Other celebrities like Common, Ciara and Russell Wilson took to social media sharing their excitement for the event.

#SomosUnaVoz: Much love to all the amazing artists taking part in this show to support our brothers + sisters in Puerto Rico! pic.twitter.com/ApuC9hBmag — COMMON (@common) October 15, 2017

Hey everyone! We’re live at the telethon! Please call in and donate! — Kim Kardashian West (@KimKardashian) October 15, 2017

If you missed the show last night check out the video above to see all the amazing work celebs did to help our fellow Americans in Puerto Rico.
